items.title: Finder Integration
items.description: E-001: Finder Integration epic. User authentication with Finder context menu integration for PDF operations. All primary actions originate from Finder context menus.

items.title: PDF Page Extraction Engine
items.description: E-002: PDF Page Extraction Engine epic. Core functionality to extract individual pages from a PDF document and create separate PDF files for each page.

items.title: Output Management
items.description: E-003: Output Management epic. Handles predictable file naming and output location for split PDF pages. Files are saved in a subfolder with consistent naming patterns.

items.title: Error Handling and Notifications
items.description: E-004: Error Handling and Notifications epic. Provides user feedback through macOS notifications when PDF splitting fails due to corruption or password protection.

items.title: Preferences and Output Options
items.description: E-005: Preferences and Output Options epic. Optional preferences window allowing users to customize output format (PDF, PNG), output folder, and naming patterns.

items.title: Right-click PDF context menu action
items.description:
US-001: As a user, I can right-click a PDF and see "Split into Pages"

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a PDF file in Finder
- When I right-click
- Then "Split into Pages" appears in the context menu

items.title: Split PDF into individual page files
items.description:
US-002: As a user, I can split a PDF into one file per page

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a multi-page PDF
- When I select "Split into Pages"
- Then N output PDFs are created where N equals page count

items.title: Predictable output file naming and location
items.description:
US-003: As a user, output files are saved predictably

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a source file named `Report.pdf`
- When split
- Then output files are named `Report_Page_1.pdf`, `Report_Page_2.pdf`, etc
- And files are saved in a subfolder named `Report Pages`

items.title: Error notification on split failure
items.description:
US-004: As a user, I am notified if splitting fails

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a corrupted or password-protected PDF
- When I attempt to split
- Then a macOS notification explains the failure
- And no output files are created

items.title: Choose output format in preferences
items.description:
US-005: As a user, I can choose output format

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given preferences are enabled
- When I select PNG output
- Then each page is exported as a PNG file
